benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/{paymentMethodId}/setDefault - Set the default payment method

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple success paths (with/without query params, optional headers) verify the default is set and side-effects (auto-pay) behave as expected (TC01–TC05).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404s covered for missing account, missing payment method, payment method not belonging to account, and account without payment methods (TC08–TC10, TC21).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent requests ensure only one default remains and system consistency/performance (TC22).
Validation: UUID format invalid/partial, extreme UUID values, and non-existent resources (TC06, TC07, TC16, TC23).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/absent; optional Reason/Comment audited (TC04, TC11).
Query Parameters: payAllUnpaidInvoices true/false/no invoices; pluginProperty multi-values/empty; unexpected extra param (TC02, TC05, TC03, TC24, TC14, TC15).
Security/Authorization: Unauthorized access (401), injection attempt in header handled safely (TC12, TC19).
Reliability/Errors: Service unavailable and downstream timeout handling (503/504) (TC13, TC18).
Regression/Behavioral: Old default cleared when setting new default (TC20).
Performance: Large unpaid invoices processing and response time expectations (TC17).
gaps: PUT - Idempotency: No scenario for setting the same payment method as default again to ensure idempotent 204/no side effects.
PUT - Partial Update Guideline: While no body exists, there is no explicit negative test ensuring unexpected JSON payload is rejected (e.g., 400/415).
Error Handling: No coverage for generic 500 Internal Server Error when backend fails unexpectedly.
Authorization: No 403 Forbidden scenario (authenticated but not authorized/insufficient permissions).
Header Validation Depth: No tests for empty/overly long/invalid charset values in X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment.
Content/Headers: No verification of response headers (e.g., Content-Type for 204, absence/presence of body, no-cache semantics).
Functional Edge: Setting default when payment method is already default (confirm no duplicate work, no extra payments).
Payment Attempts Failure Path: When payAllUnpaidInvoices=true and one/more payments fail, expected status and error reporting not covered.
Plugin Properties Validation: Not testing special characters, URL-encoded values, duplicates, or invalid types in pluginProperty.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenario covering burst PUTs returning 429 or graceful degradation.
recommendations: Add an idempotency test: setting the already-default payment method returns 204 and makes no additional payment attempts.
Add a negative test with an unexpected JSON body or incorrect Content-Type to confirm it is rejected (400 or 415).
Introduce a 500 simulation (e.g., DB failure) to validate generic server error handling and error payload format.
Add a 403 test case for authenticated user lacking permission to modify the account.
Extend header validation: empty string, excessively long values, non-UTF8 characters, and newline injection in Reason/Comment.
Verify response headers for 204 (no body, appropriate Content-Type/absence thereof) and any required cache-control headers for non-cacheable responses.
Add a failure-path test for payAllUnpaidInvoices=true where some invoices fail to pay: verify status code, partial failure handling, and audit/logging behavior.
Add pluginProperty robustness tests: special characters, URL-encoding, duplicated keys, and invalid types to ensure proper parsing/validation.
Add rate limiting/throttling scenario to validate handling of high-frequency PUT requests (expect 429 or configured behavior).
